page.title: 13Croydon Airport
page.content:
The runways are now grassland and open space. They are used for flying model aeroplanes and kites and bicycle riding. The old airport buildings and the control tower are now used as office blocks and are hidden behind newly built factories and a petrol station. Two schools and Roundshaw Estate have been built using the old airport as their play area. All that is to remind us of the old airport is a small bit of concrete by St.Elpheges School and ditches where trenches were built and where small roads had crossed the airfield. This used to be an exciting place but nowadays it is just a normal residential area.
By Joanne Williamson and Amy Knevett Thomas More School
